intro: Vladimiria muliensis, commonly known as the Muliensis Vladimiria, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form with dense, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in late spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
